Class GrundyRecPerdantes

java.lang.Object
GrundyRecPerdantes
class GrundyRecPerdantes extends Object
Grundy game with AI for the machine This version1, which is more efficient than version0, is based on a fairly obvious observation: there's no point to recalculate the decompositions of a heap (or situation) that we know (because we've already evaluated it) is a loser anyway. These losing heaps (situations) are stored in an array (ArrayList), which you simply need to consult for each heap and situation before starting a recursive decomposition (which serves no purpose except to waste time).

      boolean estConnuePerdante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)

      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if the situation is known to be losing, false otherwise

    • estPerdante

      boolean estPerdante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      RECURSIVE method that determines if the configuration (current or test game) is losing. This method is used by the machine to determine if the opponent is certain to lose.
      Parameters:
      jeu - current game board (state of the game at a given point during play)
      Returns:
      true if the configuration is losing, false otherwise

    • estGagnante

      boolean estGagnante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Indicates whether the configuration is winning. This method simply calls "estPerdante".
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if the configuration is winning, false otherwise

      Method testing the efficiency of estGagnante().

      void testCasJouerGagnant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> resJeu, boolean res)
      Tests a specific case of the jouerGagnant() method.
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      resJeu - game board after playing a winning move
      res - expected result for jouerGagnant

    • enlever

      void enlever(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, int ligne, int nb)
      Splits the matchsticks in a pile into two piles. The new pile is necessarily placed at the end of the list. The pile that is split decreases by the number of matchsticks removed.
      Parameters:
      jeu - list of matchstick piles
      ligne - pile to split
      nb - number of matchsticks REMOVED from the pile (ligne) during the split

    • estPossible

      boolean estPossible(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Tests whether it is possible to split one of the piles.
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one pile with 3 or more matchsticks, false otherwise

    • premier

      int premier(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai)
      Creates the very first test configuration from the game board.
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      jeuEssai - new game configuration
      Returns:
      the number of the pile split into two, or (-1) if there are no piles with at least 3 matchsticks

    • testPremier

      void testPremier()
      Brief tests for the premier() method.

    • testCasPremier

      void testCasPremier(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, int ligne, ArrayList<Integer> res)
      Tests a specific case of the premier() method.
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      ligne - the number of the first pile split
      res - the game board after the first split

    • suivant

      int suivant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai, int ligne)
      Generates the next test configuration (i.e., one possible split).
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      jeuEssai - test configuration of the game after splitting
      ligne - the number of the last pile that was split
      Returns:
      the number of the pile split into two for the new configuration, or -1 if no more splits are possible

    • testSuivant

      void testSuivant()
      Brief tests for the suivant() method.

    • testCasSuivant

      void testCasSuivant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai, int ligne, ArrayList<Integer> resJeu, int resLigne)
      Tests a specific case of the suivant() method.
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      jeuEssai - game board obtained after splitting a pile
      ligne - the number of the last pile that was split
      resJeu - expected test configuration after splitting
      resLigne - expected number of the pile that was split
